metadata.title: Why Is "CS+ With Emulator" Not Displayed in FSG?

sections.content:
Question:
[Using CS + and emulator] is not displayed under the Integrated Development Environment Selection of the Workbench6 First Step Guide. What are the possible causes?
Answer:
Most likely, CS + is not installed properly.
Please install the following IDE and compiler:
   CS + V3.00.00 or later
   CS + for CC V3.00.00 or later
   CS + for CA, CX V3.00.00 or later
   CS + Utility V3.00.00 or later
* *For IDE, compiler, and device dependent information related to touch sensor MCUs,
     please install the latest document version corresponding to the touch sensor MCU you are using.
     For a list of operation-confirmed compilers of touch sensor MCUs supported in Workbench 6,
     refer to the Workbench 6 User's Manual [6.2 Support Compiler].
Microsoft Visual C ++ 2012 RunTime Library (32-bit)
  (Even if the OS of the PC is a 64-bit version, please install the runtime library of the 32-bit version.)
Microsoft .NET framework 4 or later.
Workbench6 is now in maintenance status, and we do not plan to update it in the future.
Use QE for Capacitive Touch as a support tool for developing a modern capacitive touch sensor.
QE for Capacitive Touch can be downloaded from URL below.
https://www.renesas.com/qe-capacitive-touch
Suitable Products
RX113
RX130
RX231, RX230
